lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Hi. What do you need?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Hoeijendagh.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Oe 'wis't?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: All right. You're all set.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: You're set.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Everything's secure.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Ah, you again.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: You again. Welcome back.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Welcome back.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I cannot imagine what it is you've got there.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Whatever... that is, you can leave it over there.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: This isn't a storage locker, you know.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: [b]Wet shoes at the door, please--[/b] oh. Well, never mind.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I guess this sort of weather wouldn't bother you, would it?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: The mountain's going to be slick today, I imagine. Be careful if you're going up.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Nice day. Enjoy it for me, would you?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: ... Mm. It's a bit bright out, isn't it?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Nice day to be out in the garden. If only, right?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: This sort of weather tends to make people drowsy. If you need a break, you're welcome to a cot.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Are you one for full sun or partial shade?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I may step outside a moment. You wouldn't mind, would you?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Careful you're not blown away out there.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: You're looking a bit ruffled.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Up in the mountains, the wind chill gets a bit-- well, I'm sure you're familiar.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: You're going out in this?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Bit of refuge from the weather? Sure, stay a while.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Where I'm from, storms represent creation and progress. Make of that what you will.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Ms Shortte? She's not in right now. I'll... let her know you came by.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Bullfrog? Huh. Bullheaded, indeed.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Dr Lake is-- I'm not sure they treat animals, you understand.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: The officer is... well, he works hard, anyway.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I'm just the secretary.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Oh, Hendrickson? He's quite the carpenter, if you've need of a-- coop?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Ah, Cameron is-- he's one of the Post's deliverymen, no? I can't imagine you receive much by way of mail.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Mm, Hawke is... Well, he isn't exactly the most personable. Something tells me that won't be an issue for you, though.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Dr Ainsley? We're well acquainted. If you've any questions about the mountain, you're better off asking her than me.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I wouldn't bother Oz about the climb. Not that they wouldn't welcome it - rather, I think they're a bit too accomodating.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Ah, well... What you see here is about what you get, I'm afraid.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Mm. Your sort eats frogs, is that right? There's one at the Post that could use a good bite on the ankle.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Ms Tian produces excellent greenery. I... don't know how much that interests you, actually.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: What do you need textiles for? Down feathers aren't enough?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: One can only hope they don't become [b]too[/b] acquainted with emergency services.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Dr Ainsley does good work. I hope you'll take her efforts seriously and to heart.

meeting Quingee for the first time.key: meeting Quingee for the first time

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: (... He's reaching for a broom.)

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: You know, this is generally intended to be [b]temporary[/b] lodging.

after Quingee makes decent progress up t.key: after Quingee makes decent progress up the mountain

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: You're rather stubborn, aren't you? It's admirable.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Something about you seems... different.

after receiving a gift you like.key: after receiving a gift you like

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: ... Oh. Uh, thank you. That's very-- thank you.

after receiving a gift you don't like.key: after receiving a gift you don't like

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: ... Right. Thanks anyway.

after receiving a gift you're neutral ab.key: after receiving a gift you're neutral about

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Mm. This is...?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Saluu.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Hm?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Yes?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Do you need something?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I'm busy.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I've a lot of work today. Sorry.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: [b]Huh.[/b] Nosy little thing, aren't you?

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: You might watch for the birds out back. They're not as... [b]affable[/b] as you.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: I suppose it's no stranger talking to you than to a fern. I can't say either reflects particularly well on me, though.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Do you ever talk back? ... No, surely not.

lines.name: Oleander
lines.text: Despite the absurdity of the situation, I do appreciate the company.
